title: How to Evolve Girafarig Into Farigiraf: Step-by-Step Tutorial & Tips

steps.title: Girafarig evolves into Farigiraf when it's leveled up while knowing Twin Beam.
steps.content: Girafarig evolves into Farigiraf when it's leveled up while knowing Twin Beam. However, as Farigiraf is a new Pokémon in Generation 9, you cannot evolve a Girafarig into one in previous generations. [1] X Research source Girafarig learns Twin Beam at level 32. [2] X Research source Once your Girafarig learns Twin Beam, you must level it up one more time to evolve it to Farigiraf, so the earliest you can get a Farigiraf is at level 33. If you already passed up on your Girafarig learning Twin Beam, you can teach it to your Girafarig via the Pokémon's summary menu.

steps.title: Girafarig is somewhat rare in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet.
steps.content: Girafarig is somewhat rare in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet. You can only catch a Girafarig in a handful of locations, though it is also available in a new DLC area. Note that since Farigiraf is a Generation 9 Pokémon, you cannot evolve Girafarig into Farigiraf in any game released before Scarlet and Violet. [3] X Research source Scarlet and Violet: West Province Areas Two and Three; Area Zero; 3-star Tera Raid Battles The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Savanna Biome

steps.title: Farigiraf can also be found in the wild.
steps.content: Farigiraf can also be found in the wild. Much like Girafarig, it's a bit rare, but you can still find one in the wild if you don't feel like leveling up a Girafarig. [4] X Research source Scarlet and Violet: Area Zero, 4- and 6-star Tera Raid Battles The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Savanna Biome
